messages.msgSnippet: Pam, When are you going?  You will have to give me the scoopwhen you come back.  We really need to make a final decision soon so I can make all the
messages.messageBody:
Pam,

When are you going? You will have to give me the scoopwhen you come
back. We really need to make a final decision soon so I can make all
the arrangements!

Olga :)

> We're planning an weeklong RV vacation in Arizona and then a week
in the mountains in BC. I'm getting really excited - we leave the
end of May! It's taking a bit of wrangling to get it set up (and a
bit of convoluted travel to get the stopovers we needed), but I think
it will all be great fun.
>
> We fly to LA and take an overnight train to Tucson where we get the
RV. We're spending a couple nights at Kartchner Caverns State Park
then driving (stopping at Montezuma's Castle along the way) to Grand
Canyon National Park for four nights, then back to Sedona (spending
the day at Red Rock State Park) for the last night. We take the
overnight train back to LA and then fly to Calgary and drive to
Fernie, BC where friends of ours have a condo in the mountains and
spend a week there before flying home.
>
> Our whole family loves hiking and exploring outdoors so I think
we'll have a great time!
>
> Pam L.
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RV vacations was Re: typical days-starting a group
messages.messageBody:
<<Olga wrote:
BTW, I looked up RV's for my family to go to the conference(we have a
wedding in CT the following weekend so we had to go up anyway)
www.cruiseamerica.com had some specials. From Florida or Louisana it
was get 7 days and get 7 more free (about $1000). Now, you may need
to purchase additional miles and they charge you per hour for the
generator running so I am sure that will add up. However, we are
weighing all that right now. I personally think that is the ultimate
family unschooling vacation!!>>

We're planning an weeklong RV vacation in Arizona and then a week in the mountains in BC. I'm getting really excited - we leave the end of May! It's taking a bit of wrangling to get it set up (and a bit of convoluted travel to get the stopovers we needed), but I think it will all be great fun.

We fly to LA and take an overnight train to Tucson where we get the RV. We're spending a couple nights at Kartchner Caverns State Park then driving (stopping at Montezuma's Castle along the way) to Grand Canyon National Park for four nights, then back to Sedona (spending the day at Red Rock State Park) for the last night. We take the overnight train back to LA and then fly to Calgary and drive to Fernie, BC where friends of ours have a condo in the mountains and spend a week there before flying home.

Our whole family loves hiking and exploring outdoors so I think we'll have a great time!

Pam L.



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
